author: Alexandra Klausner
title: Ex-con busted in student’s dramatic kidnapping escape
text:
A 28-year-old man was arrested this week in connection to the kidnapping of an Alabama nursing student whose harrowing escape was caught on film.
Manuel Ali Towns – a convicted robber – was released from prison just two months before allegedly approaching Brittany Diggs, 25, at gunpoint on Mar. 14 and demanding money, coercing her into driving her car around Birmingham to several ATMs, and forcing her into her own trunk for several hours while he attempted to use her ATM card to withdraw cash, according to AL.com. 
Towns — whose face was captured on surveillance footage at the Gas Land station where Diggs managed to use her insulin pump to escape from the trunk — was taken into custody on Tuesday night.
Towns is charged with first-degree kidnapping, first-degree robbery and fraudulent use of a credit card. His bond is set at $500,000.
Diggs, who survived the ordeal with just a few cuts, says she plans on relocating because she doesn’t feel safe in her neighborhood anymore. Her friend set up a GoFundMe page to help her raise funds to cover the moving costs.
Diggs told the “Today” show on Monday she feared her attacker would kill her by driving the car in the river with her still in the back seat.
“My biggest fear was [that] he was going to drive this car into a river. I’m going to drown here and no one’s going to know I’m in this trunk,” she recalled.
Diggs then used the light from her insulin pump to find the trunk release latch – something she learned about while watching YouTube videos.
“I just got the bright idea to use my insulin pump light, which is not a bright light, but it was bright enough to see,” she said.
Video shows Diggs springing from the trunk and running into the gas station. Station owner Yosef Al Sabah led a distressed Diggs to a safe place and locked the door before contacting police.
